product_name: INC.redible For The First Time Bounce Blush
user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_title: favorite new products! love it so much!
review_content:
this is my new favorite blush! I purchased the milk cheek and lip stick Andre months ago and fell on love with the cream formulation for blushes, I have always used powders. this Bounce Blush is my second blush THAT isn't powder and I LOVE IT SO MUCH. I purchased it in the color "be my first kiss" which, to me, as a bit of am orange like tone to it? o don't know, I'm terrible at describing colors but it looks amazing with my skin tone. I'm very pale and warmer colors usually look better on it. it's a very smooth whipped cream, not to heavy or thick at all. but not watery either. when you apply it you need very very little and you get this perfect glowing look. I'm telling you, it's just like the product description says. it's also buildable so if you want a deeper color you can, which I also love. it's not the strongest pop of color like some blushes I have, more natural. but I think it's perfect and while I just received it today it did stay on perfectly for the 5-6 hours I wore it. the only thing I put over it was bare minerals finishing powder and I had nothing underneath. I'm not sure how if would do with other products though and I also want to say that I have oily skin. it doesn't have an oily look or shine to it and I did not notice it making my skin more oily threw the day so flags good too. if you're on the fence just do it, you'll love it. and don't be fooled by the small jar, a little goes a long way.

product_name: INC.redible For The First Time Bounce Blush

review_content: Love! The most lightweight, creamiest formula ever. Easy to apply, blend. Seriously, a dream blush. BUT. Ridiculously limited color range. And the Be My First Kiss, though described as "burnt apricot," has not even the vaguest hint of anything even related to apricot. It is straight up pink. Period. Just sayin.'

product_name: INC.redible For The First Time Bounce Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I bought 'be my first kiss' and felt a bit let down. I didn't mind the size of the product because I knew it would be a very tiny pot, but what disappointed me is a performance of it. This product has a mousse texture, it sits on top of skin, and fades really quick if applied on top of other products like sunscreen or bb cream/foundation (1-2 hours max before faded away). Its best performance is applied by stippling brush on bare skin (3-4 hours max before faded away). If you're applied with finger, most of the pigment will stick on your finger, not on your cheek. I have light skin tone and this color shows on me as very sheer wash of peach-coral which I like. just hope it stay a bit longer. I will continue using it, but won't repurchase. Attached picture is swatches on my bare skin with stippling brush (left: 1 layer, right: 2 layers).

product_name: INC.redible For The First Time Bounce Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I purchased the shade Be My First Kiss. When I purchased it, the photo on the Sephora website was of a cool toned pinky mauve shade. In the ‘details’ section it also stated this shade was a cool dusty pink. However, some time after I purchased it the online photos were updated and now the shade I purchased is attached to a coral pink photo which is the colour I received. What’s even more confusing is that in the ‘Details’ section it still says Be My First Kiss is a dusty cool pink. Regardless of the issues with shade mixup, I didn’t find the actual product to be very good. The pot is extremely small (expected for the price) and the jelly formula balls up on my skin, is streaky and doesn’t last. If you can see the colours in person so you’re sure you’re getting what you want, it might not be a bad way to try a jelly formula, but if you have oily skin I’d skip this.

review_content: Smaller than I expected but I really love the consistency and the mouse like texture. Blends beautiful. I expected this colour to be more apricot, realy colour looks more like a dusty pink. Still like it though.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: Love this blush. Keep in mind that blush is usually $30-40. This applies so velvety smooth even on top of powder! Color is buildable, perfect for someone who wants a soft blush look. Over all love this product.
